amendment.description: Amendment increases CDC Injury Prevention and Control suicide program funding to enhance youth suicide awareness, research, and prevention efforts by $2 million, and reduces the HHS General Departmental Management account by the same amount.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 59 printed in Part B of House Report 116-109 to increase CDC Injury Prevention and Control suicide program funding to enhance youth suicide awareness, research, and prevention efforts, with a corresponding reduction in HHS General Departmental Management account.

vote.text: On agreeing to the McAdams amendment (A056) Agreed to by recorded vote: 388 - 30 (Roll no. 305).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the McAdams amendment (A056) Agreed to by recorded vote: 388 - 30 (Roll no. 305).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A056) offered by Mr. McAdams.
